intro: Echium italicum var. pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula and parts of southern France. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
